comments.content:
Oh, it's called Xylo?  
Great - thanks!

hhp

That sample on Flickr reads, roughly:

"Power and beauty  
are what the characteristic forms of expression of our new advertising face, Xylo, lend to any printed piece. In combination with the Xylo 'power lines'\* that can be used in a multitude of ways, we bring you valuable material for all practical needs."

Not sure what they mean with "Kraftlinien", sounds pretty funny. Certainly lines/borders of some kind, maybe especially bold ones or something?

"Xylo-Kraftlinien" is the name of the border around the add on my flickr photo.  
Gott grüß die Kunst  
Jens

Gruppe VII - Antiqua-Varianten - Xylo  
Benjamin Krebs, Frankfurt am Main  
Erstguß 1924  
Hausschnitt

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202033440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/xylo1_6204.jpg)

Georg  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
„Ich bin ein Preuße, kennt Ihr meine Farben...“
